data:
Persuader: Hi! How are you doing today?
	Persuadee: I am good, thank you! And you?
Persuader: I am doing really good. How is the weather by you today?
	Persuadee: Rainy and a bit cold.  How do you feel about Children's Charities? 
Persuader: Yes it is rainy and cold-ish here too. I feel pretty good about charities.
	Persuadee: I was hoping you would be willing to donate to the Children's Charity - it helps sick kids with their medical costs, helps the parents stay close to them at no cost.  Do you think you could donate $1000?
Persuader: Wow! That is a lot. I have heard about all of the storms in Hawaii, and I know kids there need help. I am not sure I can give that much. How much are you willing to give?
	Persuadee: I plan to give about $100 and heard that a corporation would donate the same amount, so that would be great, wouldn't it? 
Persuader: Oh, that really would be great. I would be willing to donate. Can you take less than $1000?
	Persuadee: Sure, whatever you can afford would be absolutely amazing!!  All donations will be matched so it all adds up quickly. Would you be able to donate $500?
Persuader: I think I could donate $500. Can you make your donation a little more, or not?
	Persuadee: You know what, it is really important to help the hurricane victims so I will be happy to dig a bit deeper and donate $500.
Persuader: Oh thank you! I feel so bad about all of the children. They really are suffering. I know how hungry, and in need of medical attention they must be. I know I would be devastated if my own kids needed help. Or any of my family's kids. Do you have any kids in your family?
	Persuadee: I do have an adult child,and a grandson- so any childs need really tugs at me. And it looks like the Childrens Charity and the Hurricane Relief will help many kids, and their parents.  I am going to also add a go fund me on the internet  for the Children's Charity to try to raise more money. Is that something that you might do for Hawaii?
Persuader: Yes, Save the Children has a great website. I am going to look into what else they do. Have you looked at their site?
	Persuadee: I plan to to do that! So we have agreed that we will give $500 each to our charities. I know that will be a huge help. I thank you so much for donating to such a great cause!
Persuader: Yes. When you look at their site, you will see it is based in Ct, but they are doing great things all over. I feel really good about giving. How do you feel?
	Persuadee: I love helping anyone - especially in the US.  I am going to look into volunteering opportunities as well.  I would love to be a part of either charity. Do you actually volunteer with Save the Children?
Persuader: I have not yet. Have you?
	Persuadee: No, but our donations will be a good start! Volunteering is something I want to do very soon.  Again, thank you so much for your most generous donation and time!

Persuader: what you think about charity? 
	Persuadee: I think that it is good for people to donate to charity, especially one that will help children.
Persuader: yes, do you think the money goes to the children?
	Persuadee: I think it depends on the charity. I think there is sometimes charities that are not as transparent about where the donations go. 
Persuader: so some charities steal and some do the gods work?
	Persuadee: I don't know that I would consider it stealing. I think that some charities use funds for things other than direct support. I think it is the donaters responsibility to research ahead of their donation
Persuader: if they get couch what would be the sentence? 
	Persuadee: If they got caught stealing from a charity? or if they just don't use the funds correctly. I think it would be two different things
Persuader: the firs question, If they got caught stealing from a charity?
	Persuadee: If they got caught stealing from a charity they should go to jail. For how long depends on how much money they stole though
Persuader: and if they dont manage the funds correctly ?
	Persuadee: I don't think there should be a legal punishment for that. That would result in them losing their position
Persuader: you think that the money managing and where the money go must be transparent?
	Persuadee: Yes. If much of the donation goes to overhead costs, then people who are donating should be aware of that
Persuader: did happen something recently about a charity fraud? 
	Persuadee: Not that I am aware of. I have not heard anything about that
Persuader: what was the most amount collected in a charity?
	Persuadee: The most amount ever? A lot - Paypal raised like 48 million online for charity a few years ago. But any long running charities that are successful probably far exceed that 
Persuader: last question, what is your impressions about save the children charity?
	Persuadee: I think they are a good organization that does important work

Persuader: Hi, would you be interested in donating some of your bonus to a charity?
	Persuadee: Mybe , Maybe not . That depends on the charity :)
Persuader: It would be for a charity meant to help young kids. Save the Children is its name. It would mean a lot! It all adds up and makes a difference in their lives :)
	Persuadee: hmmm Im not really big on that one but thanks for the offer
Persuader: Do you ever like to donate toward causes? If so, what kinds stand out to you?
	Persuadee: I dont really like to donate . Especially to anything big. If  I did though it would be to local animal shelters.  Animals are close to my heart
Persuader: What do you mean by anything big? Wouldn't it be nice to donate toward something 'big' enough to help others in a meaningful way? I love animal causes though, and definitely agree.
	Persuadee: big as in they have a huge advertising budget  and ceos get huge money  like Susan G Komen and charities like that
Persuader: That's always horrible. This childrens cause though is just from the university, all the proceeds go to them directly. I don't think it's about turning a profit, as much as it providing kids food, school supplies, safe homes, etc. To those in terrible situations who need it.
	Persuadee: That is sad.  Is it local ? I dont think 1 penny should go overseas when there is so much suffering here
Persuader: I just looked that up for you - theyre actually headquartered in London, but they serve 120 countries around the world. This includes the US too
	Persuadee: Well thats good but if I were to donate to something it would have to be 100 %  USA  .. America First . Honestly though Id rather help animals
Persuader: What are your thoughts when other countries pool efforts to help americans?
	Persuadee: When does that ever happen ?
Persuader: After the 9/11 attacks, what is often overlooked is that many other countries donated toward the US to try and help. Even people in countries in the middle east and so on. I think its always really nice when people overlook any differences or distance to try and help others in need.
	Persuadee: Well that is nice but  those occurences  are rare. Like the president said  we have to put ourselves first because no other country will... Hence  America  First
Persuader: I think if everyone thought like that, nobody would get helped. The only people who would be okay would be those born rich and advantaged.
	Persuadee: Well I think we have a big disagreement on how much other people help us . I think Houston, New Jersey, Hurricane Katrina  have taught us we have to depend on ourselves
Persuader: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).
	Persuadee: I will choose  $0  .  Overseas  need is just nothing  that tugs at my heart .

Persuader: Hi! How are you doing today?
	Persuadee: I'm doing very well. Just recovering from the long weekend. How about yourself?
Persuader: I am doing well thank you and same here
	Persuadee: Awesome. What are some of your hobbies?
Persuader: Well one hobby is volunteering. I wanted to talk to you about a charity Save the Children, have you heard of it?
	Persuadee: Only in name. I haven't heard too much about it though. Can you tell me more?
Persuader: It is a charity that helps ensure children's rights to healthcare, education, safety, etc. all over the world 
	Persuadee: What do you do as a volunteer for this charity?
Persuader: Well I volunteer for another nonprofit organization, but I guess I am a volunteer in a way trying to encourage people to donate money. even a few cents can add up!
	Persuadee: Hmm, I see. Do you have information about their charity rating? How much of the donation will actually be used to help the children?
Persuader: The research team will collect all the donations and send it to Save the Children. It is a trustworthy organizaition that will use your donation to the fullest 
	Persuadee: I always like to see some report first. Maybe I will have to do some research first. Have you donated to them yourself?
Persuader: You can find more information at their website,  URL  I actually have not yet.
	Persuadee: How did you come to find out about this charity?
Persuader: This conversation actually, but any charity that helps children is alright in my book
	Persuadee: You never know though. I've heard of poorly run charities that misuse the donations. Like only 50% of your donation actually helps children. You gotta make sure your donation is helping the needy.
Persuader: you are very right, and I wish I could give you more solid proof, but I do not hae it
	Persuadee: What is the other nonprofit that you support?
Persuader: A local one that helps children with trauma and hx of sexual abuse
	Persuadee: That's nice of you. Can't ever imagine hurting kids

Persuader:  Hi, my name is Robert.
	Persuadee: hi, my name is danh
Persuader:  I will like a few minutes of your time to tell you about " Save The Children Foundation".
	Persuadee: ok please do
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: I think it's important for us to be more aware of the difficulty children are facing every single day in term of parental support, and lack of love.
Persuader: Yes, you are right, save the children is what you are saying also Your donation will make a tangible impact for the world such as help ensuring children's rights to health, education and safety.
	Persuadee: what are you suggesting?
Persuader: I am asking for a small donation.
	Persuadee: right now I just started this online job and this is my first conversation to make money. can I take a raincheck ?
Persuader: If you can a donation of .01 to $2.00 will be great, but first bear with me a little longer.
	Persuadee: can you speed up the conversation?
Persuader: You can donate to an individual child or a group of children.
	Persuadee: Can you be more specific?
Persuader: If you can donate 5 cents that will be great.
	Persuadee: I'm willing to donate 5 cents.
Persuader: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment.
	Persuadee: Ok. I'm authorizing you to deduct 5 cents from my task payment.
Persuader: Thank you very much.
	Persuadee: is there anything else I can do for you?

Persuader: Hello, I am here to talk to you about the organization Save the Children
	Persuadee: Ok, tell me about it.
Persuader: Save the Children is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to ensure each and every child's rights to health, education, safety, etc. 
	Persuadee: Do you work for Save the Children?
Persuader: No, but I am a huge advocate for the alienable rights of children and decided to spread the word about the organization in order to gain more traction for the work.
	Persuadee: What countries does Save the Children provide services in?
Persuader: Currently, Save the Children all around the globe, from the United States to Haiti, to Bangladesh, Bolivia, etc. In fact, you can sponsor an individual child from a certain country, and help provide them with the sustenance they need to simply survive.
	Persuadee: Well I think it is a noble task you are doing. 
Persuader: Thank you for very much. I was just curious if you would like to help a child in need and donate some of your task payment money  to Save the Children. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).
	Persuadee: I would like to split it - $1 for Save the Children and $1 for me. 
Persuader: That is very kind of you! These children are very grateful for people like you. People who care
	Persuadee: I am not the most charitable person but it is something... 
Persuader: And something it is! You don't know how many people would not even think twice about helping those in need. You are part of the solution for these problems. Thank you
	Persuadee: So I guess that's it for this task. Good luck with the others you are talking to. 
Persuader: Thank you. I just have one more question... What was the deciding factor that convinced you to donate to Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Well the money was right there... And I do think it is a worthy cause. So it was a pretty easy decision. 
Persuader: That's awesome. Thank you once again for your contribution. The research team will collect the donation and send it straight to Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Ok. Have a good afternoon.
Persuader: Thank you! You as well! 
	Persuadee: I don't see an option to submit, so I assume that is done on your end.

Persuader: Hello...!
	Persuadee: hi
Persuader: Hi.. I like to donate to the charity..
	Persuadee: yea! me to. i like to donate . u know children's charity?
Persuader: yes..! i would like to help and save the childrens to the organization..
	Persuadee: oh! good job. then?
Persuader: Do you have interest to help the charity...
	Persuadee: yes, sure.i am interest. do you donate any charity?
Persuader: Yes... i donate few months before.. did you do that anywhere..
	Persuadee: which charity you donate?
Persuader: save the children...
	Persuadee: oh k. then?
Persuader: Which charity you donate? 
	Persuadee: you are from>
Persuader: which type of categories to help the childrens?
	Persuadee: children education and health 
Persuader: yea...! it is nice to hear...
	Persuadee: thank u so much.  please tell me ur from?
Persuader: Am from Texas
	Persuadee: oh! really? k please help all childrens charity.

Persuader: Hello
	Persuadee: Hi there.
Persuader: How are you today?
	Persuadee: I'm doing quite fine. How about yourself?
Persuader: I'm doing well thank you for asking. Have you donated to any charities lately?
	Persuadee: If by lately you mean the last few days, no. But, about a month ago I donated to St Jude for the purpose of entering in a raffle to win a house. The ticket was $100.
Persuader: Those are a great way to give and also be able to receive yourself.  St Jude is a great foundation.  Have you ever heard of Save the Children charity?
	Persuadee: Yes, I have. I believe it's a charity that focuses on aiding children in impoverished foreign lands.
Persuader: Yes that is correct.  Are you aware about what is going on in Syria recently?
	Persuadee: If by what is going on Syria you mean the civil war, yes. I'm not too informed on the details, but my assumption, based on what I've seen on the news is that Bashar Al-Asad wants to maintain his position of power while the rebels are trying to overthrow him.
Persuader: It is unfortunate what is happening there. There has been a lack of support for children in developing countries, especially in war zones. For instance, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence. In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence.  Save the children is focused on keeping more children out of harms way.
	Persuadee: Does Save the Children assist in keeping Syrian children out of harms way? I'm assuming there must be some sort of evacuation program or that they provide medical attention and supplies.
Persuader: Yes they are focusing on numerous ways to help out so this doesn't continue to happen.  Medical attention, supplies, shelter, food are provided.  Do you want to help these children out today with the money we would be getting from this task?
	Persuadee: If the money would be sent directly to them, then yes, I would like to use the money that I would have received for this task.
Persuader: The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children.  What amount would you like to donate?
	Persuadee: If the amount that I'm allotted to donate ranges between $0 and $2, then I'll donate $1.50.
Persuader: Okay that sounds great!  Thank you very much and hope you know that your money will go a long way in helping these young people out.
	Persuadee: Hopefully this donation will contribute towards ensuring their safety and a prosperous future for them. Thank you for the opportunity to complete this HIT.
Persuader: You are welcome.  Have a great rest of your day :)
	Persuadee: Have a nice day as well.

Persuader: Hello, how are you?
	Persuadee: I am well, how are you?
Persuader: I am well.  Have you ever heard of the charity Save the Children?
	Persuadee: No, I have not, can you tell me about it?
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries. Its a great organization that also provides food for hungry children.
	Persuadee: That sounds like an amazing organization 
Persuader: I think so too.  I am going to make a thirty cent donation to Save the Children.  Would you like to match my donation?
	Persuadee: Yes, I can sure do that! 
Persuader: Wow, that is awesome!  Thank you so much.  Hopefully our combined donation will make a difference in the life of a child. 
	Persuadee: I hope so, You are very welcome. Thank you for donating as well!
Persuader: It breaks my heart to think of children not having the things they need. I just cannot imagine how difficult it is for them and I am thankful for an organization like Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Yes, children should not have to do without things they need. It is very sad. I am thankful Save the Children are doing what they can for them.
Persuader: Hope you have a good night.  Thank you again for your donation.
	Persuadee: Have a good night too! You are welcome, and Thank you for donating as well!
Persuader: You were so encouraging, I am going to increase my donation to forty cents.
	Persuadee: I will match the .40 cent as well
Persuader: Wow!  Thank you so much.
	Persuadee: Of course anything to help the children!
Persuader: Thank you.  Good night.
	Persuadee: Thank you, goodnight!

Persuader: Hello
	Persuadee: Hi there
Persuader: I want to tell you about Save the Children organisation
	Persuadee: Tell me more
Persuader: So this is charity organisation where you can sponsor a child in a country you choose
	Persuadee: what do they do for the children?
Persuader: All across the globe, children are dying from preventable causes, missing out on education due to poverty or gender, suffering from violence, exploitation and neglect, and are vulnerable in times of crisis. In every corner of the world, children need a strong voice to stand up for them, work on their behalf and make their lives better.
	Persuadee: what percentage of donations actually go to help the children vs. administrative expenses?
Persuader: In fiscal year 2017, 86% of all expenditures went to program service.8% to fundraising and 5% for administrative expenses
	Persuadee: that is a pretty good ratio but i would rather see more than 90 percent go directly to help the children
Persuader: Agree,the more money goes to children the better.
	Persuadee: how do they decide which children to help?
Persuader: You can choose yourself which one to help,there is something like catalog on their website.Where you choose which children to sponsor.
	Persuadee: how much is the average donation?
Persuader: i don't know,in this hit we can donate some part of our payment to this charity.Starting from 0 to $2.
	Persuadee: how much are you going to donate?
Persuader: I think i will donate around 30-50c
	Persuadee: i was thinking 25 c but maybe more.
Persuader: Honestly i dont think even if we donate by $2 dollars each it will really help anyone.So i will donate 50 cents.
	Persuadee: you are probably right but i need to do more research on this charity.  there are many charity scams out there and I have been burned in the past.

Persuader: Hello. How are you?
	Persuadee: I'm doing good, how are you?
Persuader: I'm doing great, thanks. So are you aware of the charity Save the children?
	Persuadee: I'm not, what is that all about?
Persuader: Save the children is a well established charity. It helps children around the world who are in need. For example, it helps children in Syria. In the first 2 months of this year, 1000 children were killed because of violence. So the charity helps address issues like that.
	Persuadee: Oh that sounds interesting, is there any way to know if they're a legitimate charity that really help people for real?
Persuader: Sure. You can go to  URL and read all about it. But I can tell you that they have an A rating from American Institute of Philanthropy and are one of the largest 50 charities, as ranked by Forbes.
	Persuadee: Oh cool well that's good to know, that sounds trust worthy. I think donating sounds like a good idea. 
Persuader: I agree. It's an amazing cause. Do you have children?
	Persuadee: Yes, I have three sons and I can't imagine them having to deal with the issues that some kids around the world deal with. Do you have any?
Persuader: I have a daughter who is 10. I can't imagine it either. It's so sad to see some of the things on the news that are happening. I'm sure you've seen some of it recently as well.
	Persuadee: Oh yeah, I do l look into that news a lot and it's tough to witness. I try to donate when I can but it is tough to find a reliable charity.
Persuader: It is tough. You want to find one that is well established. Save the children has been around for almost 100 years actually. So it's helped a lot of kids so far
	Persuadee: Well that sounds good I want to read more about it later but it seems reliable enough to donate for this HIT, at least. I think I'll probably donate $1 or $1.25 
Persuader: That would be great. Any amount that you can give will really help a child out there who needs it. In this task, the research team will collect all the donations and send them directly to Save the children. 
	Persuadee: So is this how we reach a donation agreement?
Persuader: I believe so. So you said you're looking to donate around 1.25 to Save the children?
	Persuadee: Yeah I think I will probably donate that much. I want to donate a lot but still make this HIT a decent pay. 
Persuader: That's understandable. Well if 1.25 works for you, that amount will be deducted and sent to Save the children. So that sounds good?
	Persuadee: Yes that sounds good to me. 
Persuader: Okay. 1.25 it is. They'll appreciate the donation. Have a wonderful night

Persuader: hello
	Persuadee: Hello
Persuader: how are you
	Persuadee: I'm okay. How are you?
Persuader: im good and you
	Persuadee: I'm doing okay
Persuader: are you going to donate
	Persuadee: I don't know
Persuader: okay im going to donate 1 dollar
	Persuadee: I need more information about the charity
Persuader: its save the children
	Persuadee: I'd like to know how donations are spent
Persuader: the research team will collect all donations and send it to save the children
	Persuadee: How much is actually spent on the children
Persuader: all of it
	Persuadee: So there are no admin costs?
Persuader: no their isnt 
	Persuadee: In that case i may donate
Persuader: thats great how much
	Persuadee: I'm thinking about 25 dollars
Persuader: thats good im donating one dollar

Persuader: Hey. How are you?
	Persuadee: I'm well, how are you?
Persuader: I'm doing pretty well. Have you heard about the Save The Children charity? 
	Persuadee: I don't think I have heard of it. Tell me about it
Persuader: It seems to be a lot like Amnesty International. It's an ngo that works to help kids and their rights in developing countries.
	Persuadee: That sounds great. Do they help refugee children as well?
Persuader: Yes, they do. They try to provide food and shelter as well as educational opportunities. They are also working to get kids back together with their families if they have been separated during a crisis.
	Persuadee: Awesome. Have you had any personal involvement with this charity?
Persuader: I have not. I was actually just wondering what I could do to help kids worldwide due to the things that are happening to immigrant children in this country, and I came across it.
	Persuadee: I haven't really had any experience with charities like this either. I haven't had the opportunity or funds but haven't seeked it out either to be honest. I hope to have more opportunities in the future
Persuader: Would you be interested in donating a small bit of your payment to the charity? 
	Persuadee: Yes, I would be willing to.
Persuader: What do you think was the most important factor that you considered when making that decision?
	Persuadee: Probably just that I would like to help more and I'm getting a decent pay for this study
Persuader: How much would you be interested in donating?
	Persuadee: I'll donate $1.00
Persuader: That sounds great. Is there anything else that you want to know about the charity?
	Persuadee: Where are they based?
Persuader: Their headquarters is located in Fairfield, Connecticut. 
	Persuadee: Okay, I think that's all. Thanks!
Persuader: Thanks for your donation!

Persuader: Hi, I have an offer you would not want to refuse.
	Persuadee: What might this offer be?
Persuader: Are you a fair person?
	Persuadee: I try my best to be fair.
Persuader: Have you ever stopped to think about the true meaning of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness? I meant to really think about what those words mean to you?
	Persuadee: To me, life, liberty, and happiness means doing what is right and being grateful for what I have, no matter how little it is.
Persuader: That is a noteworthy and insightful answer. Yet for some how little the have is not enough to eat. The most basic of human necessities can not be met because they are so impoverished. That is not very fair in this world of plenty, is it? 
	Persuadee: There is enough in this world so that everyone's basic needs should be met. Greedy people make sure that doesn't happen, just so their banks accounts have more and more.
Persuader: Yes, exactly right! So here is the offer to you, it is entirely your decision as to whether you wish to accept because you feel it is the right thing to do. What If I told you that you can help a child direly in need of the most basic need for survival for as little as 1 cent, and for up to two dollars you can help deliver what we so vigorously live by, a life of liberty and a pursuit of happiness. To this offer what would your response be? 
	Persuadee: I would donate $1.00, because every child should have enough to eat.
Persuader: Your are the light of hope that stays in ones eyes through the darkest of times. I can not thank you enough for your generosity. The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children. Thank you again. 
	Persuadee: Save the Children is a worthy cause. They do a lot for children.
Persuader: That is great that you know of the cause. Since you are familiar and support it, how would you feel about increasing your donation to two dollars to really brighten someone's day?
	Persuadee: I'm facing a month where money is going to be short and I have 3 grandsons to feed. We pretty much are living on a poverty level income with no help from social services.
Persuader: I'm sorry to hear that. But something to consider is that as an American Citizen you are entitled to a wide range of social services as that you might not be aware of. I would highly suggest to look into the details of every available option in your state.  Remember that is we who are the people that _ We the people
	Persuadee: The problem is that they want proof of everything, and I am getting social security for the kids from my sister, who is the legal guardian. She merely sends me the money, and there isn't any way for me to show proof of what is sent.
Persuader: Most unfortunate indeed. I am however tying to secure the well being of many many more children right now and that means my time needs to be wisely allowed. So can I make an agreement now that you will donate one dollar to Save the Children? 
	Persuadee: Yes, I will definitely donate $1.
Persuader: You are most generous, and even in hour time of need you still consider others. Myself and the Children thank you.
	Persuadee: We have to share what we have, because everything that we have is a gift from God. 
Persuader: Indeed and thank you again. 
	Persuadee: Have a nice day!

Persuader: Hi, have you heard of the charity Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Im sorry I have not
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: How does this organization raise money to help them accomplish this
Persuader: Save the Children is a non-profit organization that collects donations through various fundraisers to fund their work.
	Persuadee: Thats sounds fine. What are you trying to complete by speaking with me
Persuader: I would like to ask if you would be willing to donate some or all of your incoming payment for this task to Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Im afraid not. I believe that parents of the child are responsible to take care of their children this is Gods way. If the parent is not there to complete this it is the Churches job. Now we have people that don't go to church because organizations and governments have started doing this.
Persuader: There is a lack of support for children in developing countries, especially in war zones. For instance, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence. In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence. Save the Children does work to help these children in situations that they and their parents are unable to control.
	Persuadee: I understands that. But I do not take my money from my family and give it to another family. My family first. When I am doing surveys to make pennies I don't have money to give to other countries
Persuader: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).
	Persuadee: I choose $0
Persuader: Are you sure there is no amount that you would like to donate today?

They are a professional orgization with international impact, it is a trustable fund that uses the money for its intended purposes. Even the smallest donation amount has an impact on an orginization like this one. For the same amount that gets spent in vending machienes at school/work, or the cost of a starbucks coffee, would really help Save the Children's charity. 
	Persuadee: Wow.  I didn't know that about the small donations. I always thought only large donations help.
Persuader: Never discount the small donations, they add up over time. Larger donations make a bigger impact (of course!) but not many people are able to donate such a big chunk at a time. If we were all able to donate our entire income to the charity at least once then we could begin to really Save the Children. Do you think you would be able to do that?
	Persuadee: If you think it will help, then yes I will.
Persuader: You are truly an amazing person. How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2)
	Persuadee: I will donate 25 cents today.
Persuader: thank you so much for your donation today. The reasearch team will collect all donations and send them to Save the Children. Have a blessed weekend!
	Persuadee: Ok. Sounds good.  Thanks.  You too!!!

Persuader: Hello there, how are you doing today, I wonder if you are currently donating to any charitable organiation
	Persuadee: I do not actively donate but if it is offered at a supermarket I may donate.
Persuader: Well, perhaps you would be interested in making a donation to Save The Children
	Persuadee: Can you tell me more about this organization. How do I save the children?
Persuader: That is the name of the charity, and well, they help children in need, not only with food or resources, but also in developed countries where there are childrens that cannot go to school
	Persuadee: Is this a not for profit organization?
Persuader: Yes, all of the money you donate goes to helping children in need
	Persuadee: Is there anyway to check progress on the children and where the money is going?
Persuader: You can personally donate to one of their specific funding if you go to one of their offices
	Persuadee: Do you know where the offices are located?
Persuader: They have one in every major city of the country, otherwise you could check on their page
	Persuadee: Do you have a website I can check?
Persuader:  URL Sure, it is this one
	Persuadee: Thank you. Do you know if I can directly contribute there or do I have to go to a city to donate?
Persuader: You can directly contribute by making a donation from 0 to 2$ at the end of the task
	Persuadee: This sounds great. I would like to donate 1 dollar.
Persuader: I am glad you decided to donate, all of your money will be used for a good cause
	Persuadee: I know it will. You seem to know a lot about this organization
Persuader: Thanks, I will be donating a dollar as well at the end of the task
	Persuadee: That is fantastic I am glad you are

Persuader: I hope you will help me out by making a donation to Save the Children today
	Persuadee: Can you please provide information about the donation
Persuader: The donation would come directly from your pay for completing this task. It's money that you never saw or had in your possession.
	Persuadee: What charity is this for?
Persuader: This is for Save the Children, an international organization that benefits children in impoverished areas who otherwise wouldn't receive basic services that many of our children take for granted.
	Persuadee: How do the donations work or distributed?
Persuader: You would specify how much of your $2 payment you are willing to donate to this great cause, and the researchers will pass it onto Save the Children instead of paying it to you.
	Persuadee: What part of the country or countries does this go too?
Persuader: The money goes to Save the Children directly. While you can't know what country your money will specifically benefit, they have continuing programs in many impoverished and worn torn countries and well as in poverty stricken areas of the US.
	Persuadee: Ok, what are the donation minimums?
Persuader: There is no minimum. Every penny counts. Though you may choose to donate $0, I hope you will consider the children in your decision.
	Persuadee: Ok, I will make a donation
Persuader: Wonderful! It's greatly appreciated. How much of your $2 would you like to go to Save the Children?
	Persuadee: I will donate $0.25
Persuader: Very good. You are happy with that amount today?
	Persuadee: Yes, do you donate as well?
Persuader: Yes, I will match whatever you donate today. I do it in my (healthy) son's honor. Do you have children?
	Persuadee: No, I do not, but I like ot donate
Persuader: Well, your donation is appreciated and will be put to good use.
	Persuadee: Thank you
